Problem:
Consider a physical system modeled by the Laplace equation \\( \\nabla^2 u = 0 \\) in a region R. An external force is modelled by a function \\( h(x, y) \\) that modifies the boundary conditions of R at time t = 0. We analyze the effect of this initial condition and subsequent interventions on the solution u(x, y, t) across the domain.

If an intervention modifies the boundary conditions again at time t1 with a new function \\( k(x, y) \\), will the solution \\( u(x, y, T) \\) for T > t1 still depend only on the initial condition \\( h(x, y) \\)?
Explanation: The additional intervention at time t1 introduces new boundary conditions which will influence the solution from t1 to T along with the initial conditions set by \\( h(x, y) \\). The solution at time T is thus dependent on both the initial conditions and the intervening modifications.
